thread.title: 'Rudderless' Arsenal torn apart by fans and pundits as annual Champions League 'Groundhog Day' strikes again
thread.title_full: 'Rudderless' Arsenal torn apart by fans and pundits as annual Champions League 'Groundhog Day' strikes again

author: Sean Gibson
title: 'Rudderless' Arsenal torn apart by fans and pundits as annual Champions League 'Groundhog Day' strikes again
text:
'Rudderless' Arsenal torn apart by fans and pundits as annual Champions League 'Groundhog Day' strikes again The critics were queuing up after Arsenal's latest dismal showing Credit: Mathias Hangst/Sven Hoppe/Dan Mullan/Stuart MacFarlane/Getty/AP Sean Gibson 15 February 2017 • 10:48pm 
A rsenal's season continued its familiar path of degradation on Wednesday evening with a 5-1 drubbing in the Allianz Arena - with the entire sporting world seemingly waiting in the wings to laugh or lament. 
Pundits, journalists and former players joined the cacophony of criticism as Bayern picked apart the Gunners in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 tie, with the position of manager Arsene Wenger coming increasingly into question. 
Arsenal wilted badly in the second half, having gone in level at half time despite being well outplayed in the first period. 
The loss of Laurent Koscielny to injury less than five minutes after the break was highlighted by many as a turning point - though points of fault were plenty and varied. 
Some of the usual suspects had their say after the final whistle but Arsenal even found themselves trolled by Bayern's own official Twitter account, who posted: "Same again next year?" LIVE from Arsenal dugout. pic.twitter.com/77GcW7p3tG — Stan Collymore (@StanCollymore) February 15, 2017 Former Arsenal striker Ian Wright didn't hide his distress as the Gunners' challenge disintegrated Credit: @IanWright0/Twitter — FC Bayern English (@FCBayernEN) February 15, 2017 
A rsenal lost 5-1 away to Bayern in last season's Champions League group stage, and have been knocked out by the German giants in the last 16 in each of the 2005, 2013 and 2014 editions of the competition. 
Arsenal fans feared that their club's perennial 'groundhog day' would strike once more - and so it proved. Arsenal have completely disintegrated. An utter shambles and rudderless after koscielny went off. — Gary Lineker (@GaryLineker) February 15, 2017 Martin Keown to @btsport "It was embarrassing. This is his (Wenger's) lowest point." — Simon Stone (@sistoney67) February 15, 2017 
P redictability is hardly restricted to their European campaigns; the Gunners' meek surrender away to Chelsea earlier this month was seen as yet another example of Arsenal fading when it mattered most that they stand up and be counted. 
As an impressive Bayern set about Arsenal with a combination of flair and efficiency, the deepest flaws of the Wenger-assembled side were laid bare for all to see. 
Former Arsenal forward Ian Wright tweeted his despair mid-game, before appearing to give up watching entirely as the goals to leak through the visitors' porous defence.
